name: Chicken Shawarma Wrap

ingredients.notes: Pre-marinated from supplier, check expiry date
Wash and keep in ice water until use

preparation.instruction: Preheat the shawarma grill to 180°C
preparation.hint: Check temperature with digital thermometer

preparation.instruction: Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 15 minutes before cooking
preparation.hint: This ensures even cooking

preparation.instruction: Arrange chicken pieces tightly on vertical spit
preparation.hint: Ensure secure fit to prevent falling during rotation

preparation.instruction: Cook chicken for 45-60 minutes, rotating continuously
preparation.hint: Internal temperature must reach 75°C minimum

preparation.instruction: Check internal temperature with probe thermometer
preparation.hint: Test multiple spots, record temperature

preparation.instruction: Slice chicken thinly using electric slicer
preparation.hint: Slice against the grain for tender pieces

preparation.instruction: Transfer sliced chicken to preheated holding tray
preparation.hint: Maintain temperature above 65°C

presentation.description: Present the shawarma wrap attractively for student appeal

instructions.step: Arrange sliced chicken in stainless steel serving tray
Display fresh vegetables in separate compartments
instructions.notes: Keep vegetables on ice to maintain freshness

instructions.step: Place sauces in squeeze bottles with labels
instructions.notes: Garlic sauce, tahini, and hot sauce options

instructions.step: Garnish with fresh parsley and lemon wedges

foodSafetyAndHygiene: Wash hands thoroughly before and after handling raw chicken
Use separate cutting boards and utensils for raw chicken
Cook chicken to internal temperature of 75°C minimum
Keep cold foods below 5°C and hot foods above 65°C
Discard any chicken that has been in danger zone (5-65°C) for more than 2 hours
cookingStandards: Preheat equipment to specified temperatures before use
Monitor cooking temperature continuously
Use calibrated thermometers for temperature checks
Follow FIFO (First In, First Out) for ingredient usage
Maintain consistent portion sizes using measuring tools
storageAndHolding: Store raw chicken at 0-4°C in designated refrigerator
Keep cooked chicken at 65°C+ in holding equipment
Cover all stored items and label with date/time
Use cooked chicken within 4 hours of preparation
Discard any leftovers at end of service
qualityStandards: Chicken should be moist and tender, not dry
Meat should have even browning and char marks
No pink color in the center of meat
Vegetables must be fresh and crisp
Pita bread should be warm and soft, not hard or stale

solutions: Reduce cooking time by 5-10 minutes
Check marinade application - should be well-coated
Ensure grill temperature is not too high (max 180°C)
Slice chicken immediately after cooking to retain moisture
Continue cooking until internal temp reaches 75°C
Check grill heating elements are working properly
Ensure chicken pieces are not too thick on spit
Never serve undercooked chicken - safety priority
Add 1 tablespoon of cornstarch mixed with cold water
Refrigerate for 30 minutes to thicken
Add 2 tablespoons of Greek yogurt for thickness
Contact supplier if consistently thin
Warm pita bread slightly before assembly
Don't overfill - use portion control
Ensure vegetables are well-drained, not wet
Wrap tightly and secure with wrapper if needed

storageInstructions: Store leftover cooked chicken in sealed container at 4°C. Label with date and time. Use within 24 hours or discard.

name: Vegetable Samosas

preparation.instruction: Heat oil in deep fryer to 175°C
preparation.hint: Use thermometer to verify temperature

preparation.instruction: Remove samosa pastry from freezer, thaw at room temperature
preparation.hint: Keep covered to prevent drying

preparation.instruction: Sauté onions in pan until translucent
preparation.hint: Medium heat, don't burn

preparation.instruction: Add potatoes, peas, and spice mix, cook for 5 minutes
preparation.hint: Mix well to coat evenly with spices

preparation.instruction: Let filling cool completely before assembly
preparation.hint: Hot filling will make pastry soggy

preparation.instruction: Fill each pastry with 2 tablespoons of filling, seal edges with water
preparation.hint: Ensure tight seal to prevent opening during frying

preparation.instruction: Fry samosas in batches of 10 for 4-5 minutes until golden
preparation.hint: Don't overcrowd fryer, maintain 175°C

preparation.instruction: Drain on paper towels, transfer to holding tray
preparation.hint: Keep warm at 65°C until service

presentation.description: Display samosas attractively with dipping sauces

instructions.step: Arrange samosas standing upright in serving basket
instructions.notes: Line with parchment paper for presentation

instructions.step: Place mint chutney and tamarind sauce in small bowls

foodSafetyAndHygiene: Wash hands before handling food
Use clean utensils for assembly
Keep filling refrigerated until ready to use
Monitor oil temperature to prevent bacterial growth
Change frying oil when it darkens or smokes
cookingStandards: Maintain oil temperature at 175°C ±5°C
Fry until golden brown on all sides
Drain excess oil properly
Ensure even cooking - no pale spots
Use timer to ensure consistent cooking time
storageAndHolding: Store raw filled samosas refrigerated for up to 24 hours
Keep fried samosas at 65°C+ in holding cabinet
Use within 2 hours of frying for best quality
Do not refrigerate and reheat - prepare fresh daily
qualityStandards: Pastry should be crispy and golden, not pale or burnt
Filling should be hot (65°C+) and well-seasoned
No oil pooling - should be well-drained
Shape should be uniform and intact
Filling should not leak from seams

solutions: Increase oil temperature to 180°C
Fry for additional 1-2 minutes
Ensure filling is completely cooled before assembly
Check oil quality - may need changing
Seal edges better with water paste
Don't overfill - use 2 tablespoons maximum
Lower oil temperature to 170°C
Ensure pastry is properly thawed
Add 2 tablespoons of water to mixture
Include more cooked peas for moisture
Don't overcook potato mixture
Add 1 tablespoon of butter for richness
Reduce temperature immediately to 170°C
Oil may be old - strain and check quality
Never leave fryer unattended
Change oil if consistently smoking

storageInstructions: Fried samosas cannot be stored. Prepare fresh for each service. Raw filled samosas can be refrigerated for 24 hours in covered container.

name: Fresh Fruit Salad

preparation.instruction: Wash all fresh fruits thoroughly under running water
preparation.hint: Use fruit wash solution if available

preparation.instruction: Sanitize cutting board and knife
preparation.hint: Use designated fruit-only equipment

preparation.instruction: Cut watermelon and cantaloupe into uniform 2cm cubes
preparation.hint: Remove seeds and rind completely

preparation.instruction: Hull and quarter strawberries
preparation.hint: Ensure all green parts removed

preparation.instruction: Halve grapes lengthwise
preparation.hint: Makes them easier for students to eat

preparation.instruction: Combine all fruits in large bowl, drizzle with lemon juice
preparation.hint: Lemon juice prevents browning

preparation.instruction: Gently mix and refrigerate immediately
preparation.hint: Keep at 4°C until service, use within 4 hours

presentation.description: Display fruit salad in an appealing, colorful manner

instructions.step: Use clear glass serving bowl to show vibrant colors
instructions.notes: Keep bowl on ice bed to maintain temperature

instructions.step: Garnish top with fresh mint leaves

instructions.notes: Use large spoons for easy portioning

instructions.step: Provide small cups or bowls for individual servings

foodSafetyAndHygiene: Wash all fruits thoroughly, even if peeling
Use sanitized equipment for fruit preparation
Keep fruits refrigerated at 4°C until service
Discard any fruit that has been at room temperature for >2 hours
Check for mold or spoilage before preparing
cookingStandards: Cut fruits into uniform 2cm pieces for consistency
Remove all seeds, pits, and inedible parts
Mix gently to avoid bruising
Apply lemon juice to prevent oxidation
Prepare no more than 4 hours before service
storageAndHolding: Store whole fruits in produce refrigerator at 4°C
Keep cut fruits covered and refrigerated
Do not hold overnight - prepare fresh daily
Keep serving bowl on ice during service
qualityStandards: Fruits should be fresh, firm, and colorful
No brown or mushy pieces
Uniform cutting for professional appearance
Pleasant fresh fruit aroma
Cold temperature (4-8°C) when served

solutions: Add more lemon juice (1-2 tablespoons)
Keep fruit salad covered in refrigerator
Prepare closer to service time
Ensure fruits were fresh to begin with
Drain excess liquid before serving
Use less watermelon (high water content)
Ensure fruits are well-drained after washing
Serve with slotted spoon
Make display more attractive with colorful presentation
Offer sample portions at counter
Add popular fruits like mango or berries
Provide small take-away containers
Check fruit ripeness before ordering
Store unripe fruits at room temp until ready
Use only ripe fruits for salad preparation
Contact supplier if consistently unripe

storageInstructions: Prepared fruit salad must be used within 4 hours. Store covered at 4°C. Do not hold overnight. Whole fruits can be stored for 3-5 days in produce refrigerator.

name: Margherita Pizza

preparation.instruction: Preheat pizza oven to 250°C
preparation.hint: Oven must be fully preheated for proper cooking

preparation.instruction: Remove dough balls from refrigerator 1 hour before use
preparation.hint: Room temperature dough is easier to stretch

preparation.instruction: Dust work surface with flour, stretch dough to 12-inch diameter
preparation.hint: Use gentle stretching, don't tear dough

preparation.instruction: Spread 60ml of pizza sauce evenly, leave 1cm border
preparation.hint: Use ladle for consistent portioning

preparation.instruction: Sprinkle 100g mozzarella cheese evenly over sauce
preparation.hint: Don't overload - cheese will melt and spread

preparation.instruction: Bake pizza for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbles
preparation.hint: Rotate pizza halfway through for even cooking

preparation.instruction: Remove from oven, add fresh basil leaves, drizzle with olive oil
preparation.hint: Add basil after baking to keep it fresh and green

preparation.instruction: Cut into 8 slices using pizza cutter, serve immediately
preparation.hint: Use rocking motion for clean cuts

presentation.description: Display pizza slices attractively at serving counter

instructions.step: Place whole pizzas on wooden boards for display

instructions.notes: Use pizza wheel for clean cuts

instructions.step: Arrange slices on serving tray under heat lamp

instructions.notes: One slice per student, can return for seconds

foodSafetyAndHygiene: Wash hands thoroughly before handling dough
Use clean work surface for each batch
Store cheese refrigerated until use
Keep cooked pizza at 65°C+ or discard within 2 hours
Never reuse dropped dough or toppings
cookingStandards: Maintain oven temperature at 250°C consistently
Ensure even stretching - no thick spots
Consistent sauce and cheese portions
Bake until cheese is bubbly and crust is golden
Rotate pizza halfway through baking
storageAndHolding: Store dough balls in refrigerator, remove 1 hour before use
Keep sauce and cheese refrigerated at 4°C
Hold baked pizza at 65°C+ for maximum 2 hours
Discard unbaked stretched dough after 30 minutes
Do not refrigerate and reheat - prepare fresh
qualityStandards: Crust should be golden brown with slight char
Cheese should be melted and slightly browned
Even distribution of sauce and toppings
Fresh basil should be vibrant green, not wilted
Pizza should be hot when served (65°C+)

solutions: Ensure dough is at room temperature
Let dough rest for 5 minutes if resistant
Use gentle stretching motion, not pulling
Dough may be over-proofed - check freshness

troubleshooting.problem: Pizza is soggy in the middle
solutions: Use less sauce - 60ml maximum
Increase oven temperature to 260°C
Ensure oven is fully preheated
Don't overload with toppings

troubleshooting.problem: Crust is burnt but cheese isn't melted
solutions: Lower oven temperature to 230°C
Position pizza on middle rack
Use low-moisture mozzarella (melts better)
Check oven calibration
Ensure cheese is shredded, not sliced
Don't over-sauce - leave proper border
Use low-moisture mozzarella
Let pizza cool for 1-2 minutes before cutting

storageInstructions: Baked pizza should be served immediately or held at 65°C+ for maximum 2 hours. Do not store cooked pizza overnight. Unused dough can be frozen for up to 1 month.
